posts.post_content:
A crossover between *Mox* and *Lotus* in Magic?  
Yeah, that should pretty much provide the amount of mana you get from this card.  
...yet aren't [Mox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox) artifacts normally supposed to have a casting cost of ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol)? ;)  
  
By the way, this is the first and will most likely stay the only *one-card-infinite-combo* ever.

Posted By: Garfunculus (3/3/2011 6:05:48 PM)

posts.post_content:
[Stream of Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stream of Life).  
Now you can truly say you have infinite life. With infinite life combos, you have to set a number somewhere and declare a total of life.   
  
[Banefire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banefire)  
Infinite uncounterable, unpreventable damage. You can hose someone else who has infinite life, just hope they don't [swerve](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=swerve) you.  
  
[Stroke of Genius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stroke of Genius)  
Make someone draw infinite cards, getting the win.  
  
[Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra)  
Put an infinite x/x creature into play with trample. And then next turn multiply infinity by two. How does that work exactly? If the Hydra got into combat with an infinite [Ivy Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Elemental), would they both die or would x2 infinity win?
posts.html:
Stream of Life.
Now you can truly say you have infinite life. With infinite life combos, you have to set a number somewhere and declare a total of life.

Banefire
Infinite uncounterable, unpreventable damage. You can hose someone else who has infinite life, just hope they don't swerve you.

Stroke of Genius
Make someone draw infinite cards, getting the win.

Primordial Hydra
Put an infinite x/x creature into play with trample. And then next turn multiply infinity by two. How does that work exactly? If the Hydra got into combat with an infinite Ivy Elemental, would they both die or would x2 infinity win?
